newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada daily lumber export figures to U.S..
newsitem.headline: Canada daily lumber export figures to U.S..

text.p: Canada softwood lumber exports to the United States as of 0001 EST on January 7 in board feet, according to data from the Canadian Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade:
For the Jan 1 - March 31 quarter:
Province BC Alberta Ontario Quebec Total
EB 2.66 million 0.63 million 0.78 million 3.14 million 7.208 million
LFB --- 0.03 million --- --- 0.03 million
For the Oct 1 - Dec 31 quarter:
Province BC Alberta Ontario Quebec Total
bonus 5.29 million 7.56 million 9.11 million 50.99 million 72.95 million
EB 2.01 bln 270.25million 380.08 million 815.15 million 3.47 bln
LFB 0.80 million 2.42 million 0.38 million 8.03 million 11.63 million
UFB 0.10 million 0.26 2.81 million 11.43 million 14.60 million
April 1 - present:
Province BC Alberta Ontario Quebec Total
bonus 5.29 million 7.56 million 9,11 million 50.99 million 72.95 million
EB 6.64 bln 910.65million 1.34 bln 2.93 bln 11.82 bln
LFB 45.5 million 7.3 million 28.4 million 82.72 million 163.9 million
UFB 0.10 million 0.26 2.81 million 11.43 million 14.60 million
Source: Export and Import Controls Bureau, Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade.
NOTE: EB = established base shipments, LFB = lower base fee, UFB = upper base fee.

From April 1, Canadian lumber exports that exceed quarterly or annual quotas are subject to export fees. Exports above 14.7 billion board feet annually or 4.226 billion board feet quarterly are subject to US$50 fee for every 1,000 board feet. If such excess exports exceed 650 million board feet, they are subject to a US$100 fee for every 1,000 board feet.
Export quotas are allocated for each province on a company-by-company basis. Shippers who have not been given an allocation are subject to the US$100 fee for any lumber they export.
This export data is based on Canadian export permits. There is a one-week lag between the entry of softwood lumber into the United States and the application for a Canadian permit.
((Reuters Ottawa Bureau, 613-235-6745))
